caption: You maybe passing this place by as it looks pretty hidden. We only had 2 desserts and 2 drinks. The whisky sour was overly bitter, the Moscow Mule was satisfying.

Wow! This used to be the Savoy Bar and Grill. I used to have lunch and Happy Hour back when I was a Front Desk Supervisor at The Essex Hotel which is connected. The remodel and new name Grant Park Bistro is amazing. Outdoor sitting reminds me of outdoor cafes in Paris.
By far the best happy hour in the city! Amazing food and drinks!
Arrived at six, it was not packed. The service was very friendly and kind. This place has an awesome feel to it.
I often meet people here to talk. Had a sister come into town and asked me to take her here again. The place has a great atmosphere.

A lovely outdoor patio to sit along Michigan Avenue during Happy Hour. The mac-n-cheese and wings were delicious and the drink selection is sure to satisfy the epicurious and the 🍻 lovers. Alas, I didn't take photos this time but will do so soon on my next visit.
Great happy hour and a cute patio to enjoy the nice weather!! Love the food too!
Good place. Nice outside area.  Happy hour prices pretty good.
Staff is always super even when they have a full house. Next time I'll be back with my coworkers.
Really nice outdoor seating by the park. Good food, good service, great cake!

Went for a Saturday brunch. They have a really good special with bottomless mimosa and one entree for $30 per person! The menu is slightly limited, and I ordered a ham & Swiss omelette which was good. Service was great and the outdoor seating was nice. Small reminder though - chug those mimosas because the unlimited is only 1.5 hours (short or long depending on the type of drinker you are). Overall great place!
Traveled to Chicago yesterday and the staff here are the first people who were rude. Loved Chicago but didn’t appreciate how I was treated today.
Great location. Good food. Good service. Good prices. Don't miss the Happy Hour specials.
username: Just a Fashion Girl from Chicago

caption: My husband and I stayed at the Essex and we decided to try this place out. It was absolutely delicious! The service was wonderful and the food came out quick. I loved the steak with their sauce. I opted out for the fries for dinner and they were able to accommodate me with their house salad with cesar dressing. It was phenomenal! I'm planning to come for breakfast again today 🤣. I added todays breakfast picture as well: ham and swiss omelette.
Great food and excellent service!!!
Happy hour is the best. I do miss the chicken liver mousse they used to have though :((
The food and service team are both very good. Right now, because of Covid, they are only doing outdoor seating, to which they definitely need outdoor patio heaters ... but excellent overall.

I really appreciate waitstaff that does their job without being intrusive. The coffee was good and breakfast was exactly as I ordered it. I had the Americano breakfast, nothing fancy. Just eggs exactly as I asked them, bacon that was crispy but not burnt, and very tasty potatoes. Dining on the patio was very relaxing for a meeting with my colleague. Perfecto combinations in foods, fresh drinks important, come alone or with family, you have full options
Good food, great location, fair prices

My girlfriend and I love this place. We live in the building and you can always find us here. I have been loving the transition from a French bistro to a more Americanized bistro. You can tell they really care about you and are willing to go above and beyond to make sure you are satisfied walking out the door. I think the prices are actually very reasonable.

Grant park bistro is honestly amazing. I have been here in the summer when the patio is open and I have also been here throughout the cold winter and can say that everytime I come it gets better and better. The patio is awesome because the scenery combined with the green grass of grant park makes you feel like you are in your own quiet corner of Chicago. I am always getting the house salad as a starter, get it with goat cheese it will change your life! Everything I have ordered here has been amazing. I love the staff they are very professional and very stylish.
Absolutely love the Grant Park Bistro. Sitting on beautiful Michigan Avenue looking out at Grant Park yet very unpretentious and friendly. Great food and better service.
Food was great and staff were very friendly.

Decent prices for the area - $45 for 2 people for brunch with an extra side and two coffees. They have a special of $32 for the mimosa brunch, which is a great deal because it's bottomless with any brunch item. Their omelets are not behemoth but they're not small either. Perfect amount. The avocado toast with the egg was delicious and the bread they used was so delicious and hearty, a nutty multigrain slice. Coffee was a nice blend of medium dark roast. Near the bar is fun but they have a back dining area by the kitchen, nice lighting, and the staff are attentive. Why not 5 stars? It's the small things but not an entire deal breaker...the bacon was cut too thin and I could do without the unwanted ketchup bowl with my breakfast potatoes. Again, it seems petty but this review won't let me do 4.5 stars soooo 4 stars it is. Anyway, if you're looking for something sweet Petit Vanille is attached and they have a small curated selection of items to grab - macarons, croissants, cake etc. Definitely coming back to their dinner or lunch.
Great environment and menu selection.
Nice lunch, personally I would drop the bechemal an the flattbreads but I think that maybe is an American taste thing.

The return of LM Hospitality to the Essex was something I've long reassured for and the visit didn't disappoint. The only concerns I had were about the impending change from a Loire, France-heavy wine list to an American one and, oddly, the temperature on some of the items out of the kitchen. The flavors were spot on, regardless, and we look forward to returning.

Nice decor, great service but found the food extremely underwhelming when you compare it against other restaurants in this price bracket.  Had a steak & frites. The steak was below average quality, it wasn’t cooked particularly well and certainly wasn’t well seasoned/dressed.
Wanted a great breakfast. Overdelivered! Service is super friendly, food awesome, highly recommend you try it. Classy and very comfortable atmosphere.
Great food, great service
Such a great place!
$15 for a 3oz. Chicken breast sandwich
Very nice. You will feel special here.

My wife and I are huge fans! We live in the building and it is so nice to have a place that treats us like family. Always clean.. Always great service. Food is excellent! Good prices. Deffinately recommend if you want a great meal with great service so you can relax.
The burger is really good and the bacon flatbread is great.  Really nice outside seating in the summertime.  The other menu items have opportunities for improvement.

I went for breakfast on a Saturday morning. There is a lot of space and it wasn't super busy. I didn't have very high expectations but I ordered a Virgin Mary which was really spicy and I ordered a bacon mushroom and cheddar cheese omelette which was so good I went back the next weekend for another one. I'll definitely return here for another breakfast.
Great food and service !
Service good,
after the Chicago got chocolate run, we enjoyed their excellent brunch. A little pricy. I ordered hot water for the cold weather. It took a while to get it
The food is amazing
Really good food if you re exhausted and do not want to go put of the Hotel essex.. service excellent.
Very nice atmosphere, and the grilled Salmon was excellent!
Great atmosphere ! Great cuisine! Great service! Would be back there any day!
Food was great, drinks were awful. The old fashioned was a $12 glass of sugar and the house cabernet cost more than my dinner and tasted like vinegar.  Pretty disappointed.

AWESOME food and very friendly atmosphere!  Feels like you’re eating with family!  They all go above and beyond to make sure you’re enjoying your time and the food!  Some days I stop by there twice a day for different meals!  They all take time to remember your name!  GREAT PLACE!!!!

One of the best burgers I've had.  The aioli and house pickles made the burger.  The fries were excellent too. Recommend the 1664 Pale Lager to accompany.  I enjoyed it so much I walked back over from my hotel the next morning for Eggs Benedict Royale, which was also excellent!.
David was awesome. Delicious food. Great location.

I really enjoyed my happy hour cocktail and grilled cauliflower plate. The cocktail was refreshing and perfectly sweetened (gin and passionfruit, yum!) As a vegetarian I was pleased that the large plate with a variety of vegetables was delicious AND I left with my stomach full but not feeling heavy. Would definitely come back again!
Great place

This bistro is down the street from where I live and it has become a neighbor favorite for many of the people in this area. The food is excellent along with the service. I could eat the  Eggs Benedict  everyday . The atmosphere here is as great as the food. Thanks for coming to the neighbor bringing good food and an welcoming atmosphere.
Amazing food and wine!
The service, the food, and the location would make you think that there’s no way this place would have a great happy hour...but...WRONG! You can’t go wrong here. Highly recommend!
Eddie is the best!
Waited almost 30 minutes for my food to arrive even though the restaurant was not busy at all. Server was more interested in wrapping up things when it was 9:30Pm rather than inquiring about my food.

What a wonderful surprise! We were walking around Grant Park to get some sun and we saw this amazing patio! We needed a little break from the heat and wanted something to eat! Wonderful place, excellent menu, nicely arranged plates at fair prices! oh, almost forgotten ... the mimosas are simply great!

French modern bistro serving comfort food with laid back vibes. Came here on a whim-it was near the hotel we were staying at. Enjoyed the Royal Eggs Benedict paired with refreshing Grapefruit Mimosas. They have outdoor seating. Friendly & fast service. Bonus: A hop & a skip away from the lovely Grant Park.

All these 5 star excited reviews must be fake, as customer service here is is an utter disaster. They should fire everyone and get new competent staff. We walked into an empty restaurant on a Monday night and we had a reservation. First, there was no one at the door. 5 min later someone bothered to come sit us (there were plenty of empty tables but they put us on the worst one by the kitchen). 1 person ordered a beer, others asked for a couple of minutes. The beer never arrived and no one ever came to ask if we were ready to order for 30 min. One waiter walked past us, completely absorbed in his phone, not looking at anyone trying get his attention. I had to go up to the front and finally found a person at the bar who notified me that while the restaurant is empty, they were busy providing room service for the hotel next door (really?! why should that be my problem?). Finally, 45 min after the arrival we managed to place an order in a still empty restaurant. The food is ok, given the disastrous service, it is overpriced for a South Loop location. Do not waste your time and money going here.
Stopped in before the Taste. Loved the avocado Benedict! Fernando our server did everything with a smile. Will be back.

Waited 50 mins for our food and it was lackluster at best. No explanation was given why the two parties that were seated 15 and 20 mins after we were received their orders and were done with their meals before we were even served. Way too many good places in Chicago to waste your money here!

We were so excited to see the Bistro reopen as we had such pleasant memories of the original. The new setting is great, the staff are friendly & warm. Had 2 dinners there recently; the first disappointing which we considered an exception. It wasn’t. I ordered the Coq au Vin which was unrecognizable & would probably result in the reintroduction of the guillotine if served in Paris. Great place for happy hour but much better places in the neighborhood for dinner. Hope they fix this.
Same neighborhood as Yolk and Mei's Kitchen. Better atmosphere, better service, better atmosphere, better food. Why go someplace else?
Great M-F happy hour. 4-7 pm. Wine, beer and food specials.
Best place to have a great breakfast and brunch. Also great service

Unfortunately, the beautiful and trendy ambiance was not translated into quality service and food. The meal was underwhelming, requiring us to send back an undercooked chicken sandwich. Poor attentiveness by our server and zero smiles observed by any employee. Hopefully management can turn those frowns upside down.
Delicious food and beautiful space!

Food was good. Prices fair. Location good.  I used to go to LM when it was in Lincoln square and it was wonderful. The owner and his wife would visit every table.  now that they're a restaurant group and mostly in hotel lobbies it just isn't the same.  GPB: The food is good. Staff was friendly and service quick but it absolutely felt like we were in a hotel breakfast room. Chicago has overcome this stigma, but LM somehow still brings it to their spaces.  The Royal Benedict with salmon was really good. Coffee really good, hash browns cooked well, and breakfast meats of quality. The croissant bum was amazing! More of those, but offer preserves like a proper French petite dejeuner.  I want to love and support the LM restaurants but continue to be disappointed. Still we'll probably visit again.
Wonderful breakfast, the traditional Benedict is my go to, I could eat it all day!
Good addition to the South Loop

We truly enjoyed our breakfast experience at Grant Park Bistro on Saturday morning after our stay at Hotel Essex. We each had delicious meals, that we raved about the rest of the day. We felt relaxed and not rushed, wanting to enjoy another cup of coffee and take in the great location and design of the new space. The friendly staff all made sure we were doing okay and enjoying our morning.

Finally had a chance to stop in and try out Grant Park Bistro! I had the Bacon béchamel flatbread and a yummy glass of rosé - the perfect happy hour. Great prices, and service was attentive and quick. Did I mention how beautiful this place is? Amazing decor. Also, heard the burger was a definite must try. I can't wait to try dinner! I'll be back. A great addition to the South Loop neighborhood!
